intro: Pachira stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled pachira, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid tropical forests. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
